alert.note: Alert for Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 3:39PM EST until January 30 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...VERY COLD WIND CHILL READINGS ARE EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MIDDAY MONDAY... .The combination of very cold temperatures and winds of 10 to 15 MPH will result in wind chill readings of around 25 below zero late tonight and into midday Monday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches are expected across the northern half of Luce County. Locally higher amounts are possible. * WHERE...Luce County. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow may sharply reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions are expected to impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow showers will increase in coverage and intensity overnight, and continue into Monday afternoon. Gusty west to northwest winds up to 30 mph in open areas closer to Lake Superior and over the higher terrain will produce some blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
